DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Int
      Range: 1-5
    Air Quality Index
      Int
      Range: 0-500
    Filter Life
      Float
      Range: 0.0-100.0
      Unit: %
  ***Accept Commands***
    TurnOn [DON]
    TurnOff [DOF]
    SetFanSpeed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: Int
      Range: 1-5
    ResetFilter [RF]
    QueryStatus [QS]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the air purifier fan speed to 3 and tell me how much filter life is left?

First, I identify the relevant properties and commands from the device structure. The fan speed property is an integer ranging from 1 to 5, and the command to change it is SetFanSpeed with a parameter in the same range. The filter life is a float percentage from 0.0 to 100.0%, representing remaining filter life. To fulfill the request, I will issue the SetFanSpeed command with parameter 3 to set the fan speed. Then, I will query the current filter life property to inform the user of the remaining filter life.

Result: Execute SetFanSpeed(3) to set the fan speed to 3, then report the current Filter Life percentage to the user.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Float
      Range: 30.0-75.0
      Unit: °C
    Power
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Consumption
      Float
      Range: 0.0-50.0
      Unit: kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    TurnOn [DON]
    TurnOff [DOF]
    SetTemperature [ST]
      Parameter 1: Float
      Range: 30.0-75.0
    QueryStatus [QS]

USER QUERY:
I want to heat the water to 60 degrees Celsius. How do I do that?

Reviewing the device structure, the water heater accepts a SetTemperature command with a float parameter between 30.0 and 75.0 °C. The temperature property also reflects this range. To heat the water to 60 °C, I need to send the SetTemperature command with the value 60.0.

Result: Use the SetTemperature command with parameter 60.0 to set the water heater temperature to 60 °C.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
    Battery Level
      Int
      Range: 0-100
      Unit: %
  ***Accept Commands***
    OpenDoor [OD]
    CloseDoor [CD]
    LockDoor [LD]
    UnlockDoor [ULD]
    QueryStatus [QS]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door locked and what is the battery level?

From the device structure, the Lock Status property indicates if the door is Locked or Unlocked, and Battery Level is an integer percentage from 0 to 100%. To answer the query, I need to check the current Lock Status and Battery Level properties.

Result: The garage door is currently [Locked/Unlocked] (based on the latest status), and the battery level is at [value]%.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Irrigation Controller
  ***Properties***
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Soil Moisture
      Float
      Range: 0.0-100.0
      Unit: %
    Water Flow Rate
      Float
      Range: 0.0-20.0
      Unit: L/min
  ***Accept Commands***
    StartZone [SZ]
      Parameter 1: Int
      Range: 1-6
    StopZone [SPZ]
      Parameter 1: Int
      Range: 1-6
    SetFlowRate [SFR]
      Parameter 1: Float
      Range: 0.0-20.0
    QueryStatus [QS]

USER QUERY:
Please start irrigation zone 4 and set the water flow rate to 15 liters per minute.

Analyzing the device structure, the StartZone command requires an integer parameter from 1 to 6 to specify the zone to start. The SetFlowRate command accepts a float parameter between 0.0 and 20.0 L/min to adjust water flow. To fulfill the request, I will send StartZone with parameter 4 to activate zone 4, then SetFlowRate with parameter 15.0 to set the flow rate.

Result: Execute StartZone(4) to start irrigation zone 4 and SetFlowRate(15.0) to set the water flow rate to 15 L/min.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power Usage
      Float
      Range: 0.0-10000.0
      Unit: W
    Total Energy Consumed
      Float
      Range: 0.0-100000.0
      Unit: kWh
    Status
      Enum
        Normal [0]
        Warning [1]
        Error [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    ResetEnergy [RE]
    QueryStatus [QS]

USER QUERY:
What is the current power usage and can you reset the total energy consumed?

The device properties include Current Power Usage in watts and Total Energy Consumed in kilowatt-hours. The ResetEnergy command allows resetting the total energy consumed counter. To answer, I will first report the current power usage property, then execute the ResetEnergy command to reset the total energy consumed.

Result: The current power usage is [value] W. Executing ResetEnergy command to reset total energy consumed to zero.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Window Shade
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Int
      Range: 0-100
      Unit: %
    Status
      Enum
        Stopped [0]
        MovingUp [1]
        MovingDown [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    SetPosition [SP]
      Parameter 1: Int
      Range: 0-100
    Stop [ST]
    QueryStatus [QS]

USER QUERY:
Can you move the window shade to 75% open?

The Position property indicates the shade's openness from 0% (closed) to 100% (fully open). The SetPosition command accepts an integer parameter in this range to set the shade position. To move the shade to 75% open, I will send SetPosition with parameter 75.

Result: Execute SetPosition(75) to move the window shade to 75% open.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed
      Int
      Range: 0-3
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    TurnOn [DON]
    TurnOff [DOF]
    SetSpeed [SS]
      Parameter 1: Int
      Range: 0-3
    SetDirection [SD]
      Parameter 1: Enum
      Values: Forward, Reverse
    QueryStatus [QS]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the ceiling fan, set speed to 2, and reverse the direction.

The device accepts TurnOn to power on, SetSpeed with an integer 0-3 to adjust speed, and SetDirection with enum values Forward or Reverse. To fulfill the request, I will first send TurnOn to power the fan, then SetSpeed(2) to set speed to 2, and finally SetDirection with parameter Reverse to reverse the fan direction.

Result: Execute TurnOn, SetSpeed(2), and SetDirection(Reverse) commands in sequence to meet the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Refrigerator
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Float
      Range: -5.0 to 10.0
      Unit: °C
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Mode
      Enum
        Normal [0]
        Eco [1]
        Vacation [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    SetTemperature [ST]
      Parameter 1: Float
      Range: -5.0 to 10.0
    SetPowerMode [SPM]
      Parameter 1: Enum
      Values: Normal, Eco, Vacation
    QueryStatus [QS]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the fridge temperature to 4 degrees Celsius and switch to Eco mode.

The device allows setting temperature between -5.0 and 10.0 °C via SetTemperature command and changing power mode among Normal, Eco, and Vacation via SetPowerMode command. To fulfill the request, I will send SetTemperature with parameter 4.0 and SetPowerMode with parameter Eco.

Result: Execute SetTemperature(4.0) and SetPowerMode(Eco) to set the fridge temperature to 4 °C and switch to Eco mode.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock State
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
    Battery Level
      Int
      Range: 0-100
      Unit: %
    Tamper Alert
      Enum
        No [0]
        Yes [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock [LK]
    Unlock [ULK]
    QueryStatus [QS]

USER QUERY:
Is the door locked and is there any tamper alert?

The Lock State property indicates if the door is Locked or Unlocked, and Tamper Alert shows if tampering is detected (Yes or No). To answer, I will check the current values of these properties.

Result: The door is currently [Locked/Unlocked] and tamper alert status is [Yes/No] based on the latest device data.
